alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Washington; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 2:22PM EDT until April 01 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Washington County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Southeastern Allegheny County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Southwestern Westmoreland County in southwestern Pennsylvania... * Until 245 PM EDT. * At 222 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Wolfdale, or near Washington, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Bethel Park, McMurray, McKeesport, Washington, Jeannette, Canonsburg, Gastonville, West Mifflin, Upper St. Clair, South Park Township, Cecil-Bishop, and Jefferson Hills. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 12 and 57. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 66 and 77. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 32 and 49. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
